Package at.technikum.drivingschool.bookingappbackend.controller

Klasse AuthController

java.lang.Object
at.technikum.drivingschool.bookingappbackend.controller.AuthController
@CrossOrigin(origins="*", maxAge=3600L) @RestController @RequestMapping("/api/auth") public class AuthController extends Object
Authentication Controller Handling login, registration and logout

  • Konstruktorübersicht

    Konstruktoren
    Konstruktor
    Beschreibung
    AuthController()
     

  • Methodenübersicht

    Modifizierer und Typ
    Methode
    Beschreibung
    org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?>
    authenticateUser(@Valid LoginRequest loginRequest)
    Login method called from the login form extracts from request username and password generates JWT token on successful login
    org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?>
    logoutUser()
    Logout method sends empty JWT token to the browser browser will update cookie in cache, as cookie doesn't contain any valid data = session terminated additionally logout message is sent
    org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?>
    registerUser(@Valid SignupRequest signUpRequest)
    User registration method verifies in database if user already exits username and email address must be unique in the system returns error message in case it already exists if ok it creates the user in database

    Von Klasse geerbte Methoden java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Konstruktordetails

      public AuthController()

  • Methodendetails

    • authenticateUser

      @PostMapping("/login") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> authenticateUser(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid LoginRequest loginRequest)
      Login method called from the login form extracts from request username and password generates JWT token on successful login
      Gibt zurück:
      JWT token as cookie in header and user details in body

    • registerUser

      @PostMapping("/register") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> registerUser(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid SignupRequest signUpRequest)
      User registration method verifies in database if user already exits username and email address must be unique in the system returns error message in case it already exists if ok it creates the user in database

    • logoutUser

      @PostMapping("/logout") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> logoutUser()
      Logout method sends empty JWT token to the browser browser will update cookie in cache, as cookie doesn't contain any valid data = session terminated additionally logout message is sent
